text: We had a brilliant week here with two children (7 & 4)The hotel in general was immaculately clean. There were staff constantly cleaning and maintaining all the areas. The pool is cleaned daily and the whole pool area is power washed.Our room was spacious and clean with good working air conditioning. A bonus was finding a drying rack on the balcony!The pools were fantastic - clean and interesting with steps and slopes, splash parks, a thrilling waterpark which both children could enjoy and a quiet pool. The water was chilly early in the week but you acclimatise quickly. Later in the week though with glorious weather the water was actually warm and very comfortable. The water park was a huge hit and there really werenâ€™t any queues which meant we went on the slides on repeat!The food was fantastic! Iâ€™m not sure why I see reviews saying there isnâ€™t much choice - there is such a huge range of food which is beautifully presented and caters for all palates. My 7 year old had the time of his life sampling so many fresh foods and specials. There are great themes as well eg Indian night, Latina night, Americana etc. My picky 4 year old found loads to cater to his needs and obviously stocked up on ice creamThe staff are polite and helpful and there are no long waits at bars or in the buffet. The housekeeping staff are friendly and did a great job keeping our room clean through the week with new bedding and towels. Reception were very helpful and even organised a breakfast bag for our early departure.The shuttle to the beach was really handy and gave us a nice break from the hotel - the beach and old town were fantastic.My children went to the kids club and had a great time (they arenâ€™t easily pleased!) - the days were themed and tied in with the mini disco in the evening. Very neat!All in all a wonderful trip and a brilliant stay at Jupiter - cannot recommend enough - thank you to all staff ðŸ©·
good hotel, very clean and friendly staff.Had a nice holiday with good food, swimming fun and lots of sun.
We enjoyed 10 relaxing days at Belmar Dpa&Beach Hotel. We booked half pension. Food at Levante Restaurant was very tasty and rich in variety.

The stay was quite pleasant, room could be a little more spacious, strong point in the cleanliness and sympathy of the staff. Breakfast very nice and in the right amount. Very good spa, to improve the jacuzzi integrated in the indoor pool, as it should be stronger to feel and have relaxing effect. The ice bath in the relaxation circuit was spectacular but on the 2nd and 3rd days it was broken. I'd stay back.

Over all a very nice hotel lots of things to do for adults and children not to far away from local amenities good amounts of food and drinks available I would definitely consider staying here again if we come back to Portugal

We arrived on Saturday evening and decided to go out to find something to eat. We found that everything was in town, which is a 40 to 50 minute walk down the steep hill. We had a wander around  near the hotel and found a local pub open and ate there. The hotel is located on a very steep hill, and getting back was quite a hike.On Sunday, we decided to walk into town and found that most of it was shut. We decided to eat our evening meal at the hotel. The food was good but the restaurant had very little atmosphere. We didn't like the quietness with people whispering and the gentle noise of cutlery on crockery. We didn't eat there again in the evening.The breakfast maybe was more suited to German tastes. Many other guests were German.We had a good look around and the hotel has some lovely areas and facilities. The views over Funchal were superb. Maybe it's good if you just want to stay in the hotel.We hired a car because we really needed to, to get anywhere. A local yellow taxi had charged us â‚¬15 for a five minute journey. The hotel car park was close and free to use. The roads up to and around the hotel were quite challenging. There were lots of one-way systems, and we got lost even with a sat nav. The road system at the bottom of the hill was particularly confusing. It's not directly to do with the hotel, but having to endure and cope with that was part of the experience of staying in the area.The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the room maid did excellent work every day.In hindsight, we should have booked closer to the town or in a quieter area with user-friendly roads. The hotel was good, but the location ruined the experience for us.

A crowded but clean experience, with an average to sometimes poor Buffett selection, and lifts that will have you waiting 20 minutes to reach the ground floor at prime times.Our stay with The Jupiter was mostly event free with the one exception being the wait for an empty lift around prime times. This was exasperated by being on the 7th floor.The hotel offers a relatively small amount of entertainment for children. Including a small climbing frame and slide, soft play, and shallow swimming pool with water slides.Disappointingly for the duration of our stay the childrenâ€™s buffet selection did not extend beyond chicken nuggets and spaghetti bolognaise, but this was balanced with fruit, veg and salad from the adult buffet area.Staff were always polite, attentive and helpful. WiFi good throughout.Location was central but required taxi (Uber is great here) or use of shuttle bus to get in and out of new and old town with families as paths can be tricky to walk.Our room was pool facing and so could hear the noise from the night time entertainment even from the 7th floor on the far side. I suspect closer rooms may have a more negative experience. However if youâ€™re going to bed later this may not be an issue, bed time for our 2 kids was around 9pm.

We booked the Belmar for an impromptu trip to the Lagos area. Having stayed around Porto do Mos before we are familiar with the area. The hotel looks very nice. Parking on site for cars. Friendly staff at reception. We had a 60m square modern apartment within the hotel complex. Sea view too. It was well equipped and generally clean. Just the bathroom needed some attention ( 2 light bulbs needed replaced and the plug in the basin did not work).We didnâ€™t fuss about it as we were there for such a short time. The kitchen was excellent with dishwasher and Washing machine ( bring your own tablets for these, cheaper). There was a coffee machine too. Again buy or bring your own coffee pods for this. Air conditioning worked well for us. The towel issue (as discussed by other trip advisors) was very irritating and disappointing for what is a classy establishment. The towels generally are small and thin ( worn out). No towels supplied for bidet use. No face flannels either. Our bathroom towels were replaced as needed ( daily). The spa towels varied in size and quality. The â€œticket â€œ system is not unusual in Europe and North America. But really unnecessary! I would bring my own beach towel if visiting again ( there is a good washing machine in the room. â€œToiletries supplied â€œamounted to wall mounted hand gel / shower gel only. The digital safe has been â€œmodified â€œto take an actual key (another other thing to worry about losing!). We didnâ€™t use the restaurant or bar as we like to self cater or eat in the abundant restaurants in and around Lagos. The queues at peak breakfast times confirmed weâ€™d made the right decision. The lobby bar looked rather dreary. Nice little drinks kiosk at the outdoor poolside. Rent a car or use taxis to get around. I would come back if the hotel updated itâ€™s towels etc.

This place I just awesome. Rooma are great. Big. Service is great. Pool area fantastic. A bit disappointed that you have to pay for parking even thou you staying at the hotel. But other then that. All good. Food is fantastic.

This is a quiet and peaceful hotel in the countryside just out of Portalegra. The manageress Lucia was excellent.  She spoke excellent English, was very friendly gave good advise regarding  places to visit, restaurants etc.  The Hotel is decorated with historical artifacts and Lucia gave a guide to the building and explanations regarding the artifacts.  Breakfast was very good and served with a smile by the staff.In the morning the local farmer brought his goats to feed on the grass nearby and the sound of bells was very enjoyable.I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & ChÃ¢teaux
text: This is truly a  5 star boutique hotel with all amenities (except parking). Impeccable design aesthetic and service. 2nd time here, I would highly recommend for travelers with discerning taste. The service was great and the hotel is very centrally located on Avenida Libertade

We arrived for our 11 night stay here (and my mother in law stayed for a week) and we were all very happy with our hotel. The reception area was beautiful, with friendly staff always available - nothing was too much trouble, including making a cake and providing complimentary fizz for my husbands 40th birthday!Special thanks goes to Ali, the restaurant and bar manager, who looked after my dietary needs as Iâ€™m coeliac. He always made sure I knew exactly what I could eat at the buffet and went over and above to ensure I didnâ€™t become unwell (I didnâ€™t!) He always made me feel safe and comfortable to eat the food provided.The rooms were clean, spacious and having our own washing machine was a bonus, particularly with having a three year old! We had a ground floor room but had no issues with noise whatsoever.The local amenities are all within walking distance and you can easily catch a taxi or tuc tuc to get around. My husband enjoyed using the gym and sauna, and my daughter loved the kids pools.I would 100% recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: The resort itself is very picturesque, the views from the cliff are amazing. We stayed in top floor 1 bed suite, most of the rooms have partial sea view not from the room itself but from the balcony. Fully furnished kitchen is definitely a huge plus as well as a huge bathroom which is cleverly integrated into the bedroom. The spa which is located in the same building is great as well when it's not packed. So overall the resort lives up to expectations, the only downside is that they start mowing their lawns at about 7:30am 2-3 times a week and if you like sleeping in while on holidays this may become an issue as their mowers are extremely loud.

We stayed for 5 nights and were impressed with the hotel.  The staff were very efficient and welcoming throughout our stay.  When we arrived our room was upgraded to one overlooking the square which was lovely.  The room was tastefully decorated and really quiet.  The breakfast was great and the restaurant was always popular in the evenings.  The area around the hotel appears to be being developed and an area of Lisbon which is obviously growing in popularity.  The hotel is located near to many of the main visitor attractions and transport links.  Would definitely recommend.

I've been returning to Lisbon Destination hostel again and again since it opened. It really is fantastic and I wouldn't choose to stay anywhere else in Lisbon.First of all the location is wonderful - in the very heart of Lisbon and with vibrant places to visit on its doorstep. The hostel itself is beautiful - the communal area is an indoor garden with hammocks and beanbags - a great place to socialise and relax. The hostel itself is so good that it would be very easy to stay inside all day without even venturing into Lisbon! I stayed in a private double ensuite decorated beautifully.The staff could not be warmer and friendlier - a real asset of the hostel. They organise activities every day - a great way to experience the very best of the city and make new friends if you're travelling alone.In the morning a great free breakfast is served - coffee machine, pancakes, fresh bread, fresh pineapple and watermelon and hams, cheese and jam. In the evenings an award winning chef cooks dinner, served with carafes of wine.I made lots of friends here and cannot rate this place highly enough. I'll definitely be returning, but it's no surprise that it becomes booked-up quickly so it's worth planning in advance!THANK YOU to all the wonderful staff who really made my stay so memorable and enjoyable!

We stayed 4 nights in this hotel in mid-June 2024. (Room 405, ground floor with sea view).The 4 star rating should be weighted to fall between \average\" and \"very good\".The positive points...Beautiful hotel
sentiment_score: examples: we cannot escape the neighbors' conversations
column12: nor the noise of running water when they take a shower!2- If the dining room is suitable for breakfasts (very generous)
column13: it is not suitable for dinners (solution: go to the terrace if the weather permits).3-Maintenance of rooms:cracked shower screen
column16: rusty bay window sliders...Can do better !4- Parking: little space to park nearby so arrive before 6 p.m. and don't forget to fold down the mirrors of the rental car....this can be useful..."

text: We stayed in Estalagem da Ponta do Sol for a week before Christmas in 2013. It was the low season and we had a pretty quiet stay (which was nice). We traveled as a couple and that's what the hotel suits best for. It had a few bars, which were definitely not crowded so the service was fast. In short it's a nice hotel with friendly staff, modern style and awfully slow internet connection which shouldn't be marketed.Arrival and free ticketsUpon arrival we were given free drink tickets that were valid for first and second night. We missed the dates but checked the bar later. We also got discounts for the spa treatments but ended up not using them. They were a nice addition, too.Great food, low on optionsThe breakfast was good with bacon, eggs, breads, lots of different fresh fruits (not canned fruits), cakes, cereal, muesli, juices and coffee. The classy restaurant has beautiful views from it's high windows down to the town of Ponta do Sol, a beach and sea below. The meal and dinner tasted great, but the menu wasn't very long and it didn't change. It's great for a short stay but not for a week or more unless you want to try new food every time. For this reason we didn't eat there every day. Oh, and even though I like serving things in a new way, I do wish the hamburger had bread!Hotel and beautiful surroundingsThe place where the hotel stands is beautiful. The hotel sits on top of a high cape and has views to three directions with a lot of sea around and the valley with the town. You ride a tallish elevator to reach the reception in more traditional building, the restaurant and bar are also nearby. Then you take a short elevator ride for the top where the accommodation buildings, pool area, saunas and another bar sits in - the second bar was closed during our stay. The hotel in general is stylish and modern, while not being sterile. The lower bar for example has a very warm atmosphere with fireplaces inside and on the terrace. The latter ran out of fire while we were enjoying our drinks and it got cold quite soon.Pool and saunaThe infinity pool shown in pictures was nice, though the water in December wasn't too hot but still enjoyable. Then again, if it was too cold there was a heated indoor pool with funky lights changing colour from light blue to pornish red. There was also a traditional sauna which was great. Some instructions on how to use might have been on place. We were said it would be always on upon request and when we later asked about that at 8 pm clothed in bathrobes it was said it's turning off at 8 pm. Duh. When we finally go there there was twice some hassle when other people were about to use it too. No big deal though, I'm glad they had one, it's the most relaxing thing ever!Friendly staffThe staff was friendly and room make-ups we're quite in-depth. One day we went on an early hike for the mountains and asked for an early breakfast - it was no problem for the hotel. There was two dogs free inside the hotel. I love dogs, but the other cutie seemed to have bad hair and it scratched itself often. I noticed it enjoyed the evenings on the sofa at the bar close to the warm fireplace. I figured I better stay on the chairs just to be safe.Stylish room with sucky internetOur room 306 was okay. It was marketed as sea view room and with a wi-fi in it. The room faced northwest to the direction of the town and partly the sea and it was on the second/third (top) floor (depending how you count floors in your country!). The room was high with a bathtub in the bath room. Unfortunately high ceiling meant that it warmed up quite slowly so you had to put the A/C-heater on whenever you were in. For the electronics (outlets, A/C) to be on a card (any card would do just fine) was required to be in a slot next to the door. So it was a bit chilly, but the blankets were great!The sea view was actually a 1/4 sea view with most of the view being down to the town. I liked to watch the streets, building and hills, but my girlfriend found the sea to be more comforting and wish it would have played a larger role. Our room was not in the west (sea facing) corner of the building, but close to it.Biggest annoyance was the wi-fi or wlan the room was supposed to have. I was supposed to answer some e-mails during my visit but it was proven harder than expected. I had a few devices with me and each failed to connect the network several times and when they did the speed was unbearably slow. I had to refresh pages many times and wait easily ten minutes to see if a page loaded or not. This is the only thing I mentioned to the hotel staff and they advised to try it on the balcony. The signal strength was good but still the internet was slower than anything. I actually tried to take a photo of an internet speed test site for this review, but I never got the test site open! How bad is that? Try to check your mail on that then. While it forced me to fix on the relaxing part of the holiday, it drove me nuts as there was still some things I was expected to do during my stay and I was unable to do them. Also I relied too much on checking maps etc in the room from the internet - obviously it was a hard task with the offered connection. Thankfully I had offline maps in my phone and we navigated our rented car with those.We had a \two person room\" so I can't say much about the beds. I wished we had a double bed but it was a twin bed with beds moved next to each other. So there was a crack between the beds and the mattresses tended to slide if you tried to balance between the mattresses. We didn't say about this so the issue might have been fixed should we have mentioned it.The fridge in the room was great
month: it allowed us to stock it up with goodies. We have never really needed an actual minibar with all the expensive snacks. I understood it would have been delivered if needed
year: but I definitely liked the (minibar sized) empty fridge to put our own stuff in.The rooms weren't really that well sound isolated. The waves hitting rocks down the beach were calming
extracted_date_str: but the Germans partying downstairs were not. Neither were the tv-sounds from the next room
extracted_date: the fellow quests walking down the outdoor corridor while chatting
year_int: the early new year crackers from the town exploding loudly occasionally and the Christmas parties from the town beach.Overall the hotel was great
sentiment_score: the staff was great and the atmosphere was relaxing. The minor annoyances didn't slow down from reaching the holiday feeling except for the wi-fi which drove me nuts when waiting to open the pages.I hope you found this helpful!"

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & ChÃ¢teaux
text: We stayed at the Valverde Hotel November 9-13 and found it absolutely enchanting.  The staff was amazingly friendly, professional, and attentive.  The rooms were very attractive and comfortable and the location on the Avenue de Liberdad was great.  We were particularly impressed by Christelle Penven, the Front Office Manager.  She repeatedly went above and beyond what was necessary to find restaurants, tours, and sights we should see.  She is one of the best I have ever seen.

Clean and comfortable perhaps in need of a little TLC but convenient for central Lisbon and nearby car parks. We used Holmes Place which cost 55 euros for two days. Our room was small but adequate only lacking in coffee/tea making facilities.Breakfast was impressive in terms of variety and quality but could have been so much better if the hot elements were hot, or even luke warm. Cold fried eggs or cold scrambled isnâ€™t nice. We did not see any of the hot trays replaced or for that matter the coffee urns, meaning that the coffee was stewed and barely warm.That said we enjoyed our stay and will use this hotel again.

Nice, clean, modern rooms. Nice area that felt safe. Easily accessible to public transportation. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would have liked more options for breakfast and  some variation daily. The bed was very comfortable and house keeping was great!

We have just returned from a week's stay at the Albacora and had a great time. The hotel was excellent and the staff were very friendly, efficient and always on hand to help. The rooms and food could not be faulted and the amenities were great too.A special thank you to Pedro Santos, the Assistant Manager, who took time out to personally ask us about our thoughts on the Hotel and was always available if needed.Robert and Irene Munro

We were set down from the coach at the end of the road as the road is too small to get the coach down. However, it is only a few yards to the apartments which are situated on both sides of the road - reception, dining room/bar, B&B on one side and the apartments on the other side. We were horribly delayed but the owner had waited for us to arrive.A lovely large clean room. We did have a problem with the toilet overflowing which was quickly sorted out. The apartments are set around the small poll which has some loungers. It was very quiet. I am not sure whether this was due to the fact if you spoke everyone could hear you or at age 50 we were the youngest.It was deserted around the outside of the hotel, there are some commercial buildings and waste land depending on which way you go into the town and we had been warned to be vigilant but we never saw a soul.Approx 3 minutes to the see front promenade and 5 to the edge of the bars. It is hilly but we did not find that a problem.Great value for the price

Life would be much nicer if your favorite things, places, restaurants, hotels and people would continue to give you reasons to continue as \your favorite\". Lisbon Marriott Hotel continues to be the good old same. I highly recommend it. Nothing with three hundred stars and towers that try to finish the task started with the Babel one. It still understands me."

The room at the Santa Luzia was modern and very nice. The hotel is positioned very close to the historical centre so youâ€˜re close to all the restaurants by foot in no time.It would have been nice if the customers wouldnâ€˜t have to pay extra in order to use the pool or the spa.Also thereâ€˜s no free parking provided by the hotel so youâ€˜ll have to stay in the parking just in front for a daily fee.Staff was a bit unfriendly.Otherwise a very nice hotel.

We were terribly received at this hotel, as the attendants were always in a bad mood. It was the worst experience in the trip! The room was really confortable, but the location could be better, especially if we take the high prince into account.

Since I last visited the restaurant has vastly improved its attraction & standards. The staff still provide marvellous service and the villa quality is good. The estate generally over the years that I have known it - over 25 - has maintained a high standard of landscaping. Unfortunately they have not yet found a solution to insect bites!

We stayed in a room right next to the street which is cobbled. With the roof top bar right on top of us (amazing view btw) abd the street next to us, we barely managed to sleep. The young stuff are very friendly though and gave us a 50% discount because they apparently had a party in the bar that night. Apart from that, it's a lovely old villa and if it hadn't been for the noise, it would have been very good value for money.

Terrible. It should by no means be classified as a 5-star hotel. Bad experience from the moment we arrive to after the exit. Small room smelling of mold. Trouble with the laundry. We had to leave without our clothes. We were charged too much, and the Processing for troubleshooting was terrible. Not even recommended if youâ€™re looking for a budget hotel.

Wow, simply wow! Arrived late last night armed with passcodes after and eventing journey, hubbie left his coat at home and my heel broke on the escalator at Lisbon airport, we were delighted that the apartment met all of out expectations.Spotlessly clean, roomy and well laid out.Waking this morning we have a great view from our balcony, we are on the fourth floor and the double doors on to the balcony are a dream.Looking forward to our week here very much, itâ€™s home from home!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: This is our second visit to the Reids Palace and we are in our final week here. On looking at the negative reviews we have to totally disagree. My husband and I are in our 40's and our son has just turned 11. There is so much for our son to do and loads of children his age and slightly older. Is he bored?  Definitely not.. Are the other children here bored? I do not think so. From diving into the sea, to their own computer room, billiards room, events just for children there is so much for them to do. Are we surrounded by elderly people? Unless you are classing 40+ year olds as elderly then maybe so. I truly believe it is down to the time of the year you visit the hotel. If you want younger people, come during the summer and school holidays. If you want quiet and an older generation come out of season. Once you have been to this hotel you will be spoilt for future hotels. The joy of not having to fight for Sun beds in the morning is worth every penny. The service, the way you are made to feel special is what this hotel is all about. You cannot fault it in anyway. Yes it is expensive but before you go you know this due to the price of the holiday so why complain. The Williams restaurant, perfect.. I would definitely recommend, by far the nicest meal we have ever had. We just had their normal menu but the way it was served and presented,in the words of our son. WOW. They even offered to prepare a dish for our son if there was nothing on the menu he wanted. I am writing this review whilst sitting watc hing the sun set in the grounds of this beautiful hotel filled with so much history. I hope it does not change as to us it is perfect just the way it  is.

Fantastic hotel with excerlant staff nothing is to much trouble great location the food is also excerlant. Our only disappoint was that the la carta menu was only available on a couple of occasions but the special menu were ok.

500 meters to the start off point for the Portugues Camino coastal route from Porto (Matosinhos) to Santiago de Compostela.  Charming couple operate this spotlessly clean hotel located along the tram/metro line from Campanha train station where we arrived from Lisbon.  Quiet and light room.  Close to pretty city park and good choice of restaurants.  Very reasonably priced. Good breakfast.

Very good hotel, well located and with great service. Friendly and helpful service from employees. Great breakfast! Sensational mixed eggs... Good cost benefit for those looking for comfort and tranquility in the family! I recommend!

date: Anny F. J. Smithwrote a review Apr 2023
text: An excellent establishment. Attentive and helpful staff, from the front desk to the director. In addition to cleaning during the day, at night they shut the windows and we had chocolates. The breakfast was fabulous. The hotel is close to several tourist places, I will definitely be back.

The room we were allocated is not the smallest, but it was still of a restricted size - to the point where 2 open suitcases could not fit. At night, the room is dark, even with all the lamps on. The decor is dated. The bathroom is bad - the shower drain is blocked, causing water to accumulate, in addition to leaking water into the rest of the bathroom (which is completely open to the bedroom). The stall, where the toilet is located, did not have a lock because it was damaged. Good breakfast - only the quality of the coffee beans leaves something to be desired. The service is good, but nothing exceptional.The hotel's facilities and service do not match the 5-star rating - they are far below. We checked out earlier than expected to change hotels.

Everything you could want if you want a relaxing holiday with stunning views and attending to by very friendly and helpful staff, nothing was too much trouble. Rooms, restaurants, lounging areas and rest of facilities excellent.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Make no mistake about it, this is a genuine five star hotel, a gold-plated, no ifs-or-buts five star hotel. Everything about it, from the superb location overlooking Funchal Bay, to the exquisite and plentiful public rooms, the sumptuous bedrooms, the top-of-the-line service and the excellent food oozes class and style. It may be expensive, but it's worth it. I was tempted to deduct points for the late announcement that there were going to be renovations during our stay, involving closing two of the restaurants, the inconvenience of losing our beautiful Garden Room for breaksfast and the (slight) noise round the pool area - but that would be carping and petty. This is a magnificent hotel offering a magnificent experience.

Very pleasant staff. I had to check out early because.of a personal problem but Iâ€™d return to the hotel. Excellent location although the restaurants in the area are over priced. Lisbon has way too many American tourists for my taste and has lost most of its charm.

We have just returned from two weeks at the Pestana Viking. This hotel is not 4 stars at all. The furniture in our room was old..and we think that it was also old everywhere in the hotel..we didn^t find in our room teapot and some spoons etc...Breakfast - so everyday all the same food..:( And many facilities were closed..But one thing is good - Pestana Viking is situated in a quiet place, far from disco-clubs,  loud bars, etc...The beach was nice, not so many people..In the whole we enjoy OUR vacations in Portugal

Really friendly staff upon arrival, offered drinks whilst waiting to check in! Only thing we couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t check in until 5 but they said we could keep our bags in a locked room and use all the facilities while we waited! Evening food was good, lots of choice and good selection for kids! Breakfast was ok but did haven better up the road in cafe sol. Apartment was lovely and clean; cleaners really friendly and came half way through our trip with fresh bedding and towels which we needed. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d definitely return to this hotel, bargain for the price we paid too! Close to the beach, 10/15 minute walk to the strip but lots of pubs and food choices along the way

Stayed here in September for 4 nights. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived as the reception and pool looked so nice but that pleasantness left as soon as we stood inside our room and was replaced by a damp musty smell.To say the apartments need upgrading is a gross understatement. From the bathroom to the kitchen, bedroom and sitting room the place was filthy,rising damp, smelly bed clothes furniture in bits and kitchen appliances disgusting.In the twenty years I am travelling to Albufeira this is definitely the worst place we stayed in.

As i was late arriving due to delayed flight and getting off Metro at Carolina Michaelis instead of Casa de Musica, which is more direct to accommodation.I met with host  Joanna who gave me a lot of sound advice for my trip. It was a miserable evening when i arrived, the room was very clean and warm also the bed looked very inviting.The shower was excellent, towels and shampoo  were supplied.I would recommend a bakery/restaurant for breakfast or light snack not far away on Rua Julio Dinis, it is spotless and the staff are brilliant.I can highly recommend Three Houses Apartments.

After reading some very negative views I was somewhat wary of staying here. I have no clue what the moaners were on about! Honestly it was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Spotlessly clean and lovely rooms.I always take a travel kettle so no problem with having a cuppa in the room.We were given a free upgrade and had a lovely view on the marina side. No noise from the casino at all.To the people moaning about only 1 chair on the balcony move the inside one outside! Problem solved! Delicious breakfast with fresh fruit,cereals,breads and cooked items.No complaints there. Minutes from the marina and beach. As for poolside sun beds, as we are not ones to sit all day at the pool this wasn't a problem for us but we went down early one morning and got 2 beds no bother and the other times we went later in the day again beds available.This has to be one of the best hotels in Vilamoura for the price we paid. We will return.Oh and the staff were very nice also. Smile and be pleasant with them and they will respond accordingly.Would love to return.

Fantastic short holidays at the Pestana Viking Hotel,The location is privileged, nearby the beaches and the sea view is amazing.The swimming pools, sauna,gym and garden at the premises are a challenge to enjoy the stay.Very good staff and opportunity to do a boat trip to see the dolphins and the natural caves of the coast rocks.Highly recommended.

Go during off season.  Big resort right on the beach.  Prices are reasonable.  All inclusive food plan was a score.  Beautiful location.  We were happy to be there in November and avoided the summer crowds.

Definitely not a 4 star hotel, we had booked deluxe room and it was incredibly small, facilities in the room were minimal and if you decided to self cater you would struggle. Bedroom itself was tiny there was little to no room between the bed and the wall and the door to room barely opened because of the size of the room. On our first night we complained about a hole in the bath tub the had brown stuff coming from it  and were told maintenance would be around to fix first thing next morning but never showed when we complain later that evening we were told we'd be given a new room and to come back an hour later but when we returned staff at reception had changed and the new staff had no knowledge of us being moved to a new room and had to scramble to accommodate us. The new room was a little bigger and the only reason why I gave 3 stars. If you have mobility issues I wouldn't recommend this hotel as its on a really steep hill and alot of stairs to get to 90% of the rooms

Our family stay was simply wonderful! We were lucky to have a pleasant climate, which made the experience even more special.From the moment of arrival, we were received with a memorable sympathy and attention by the hotel staff. One detail that enchanted us was the mimic left in our room on the day of check-in, a very special gesture. The room was spectacular, with a front view to the sea that provided us with unforgettable afternoon ends, with a stunning sunset.We had the opportunity to try the buffet and we were very satisfied. The variety and quality of the food exceeded expectations, and the service was worthy of a hotel with more than 4 stars.We thank you for all the hospitality and will definitely be back one day!

I have no complaints about this hotel whatsoever BUT I just want to warn people who do not stay there via a travel agent.  We arranged for a private transfer to and from the airport to the hotel so was surprised when the driver handed us an envelope from our 'Rep' who was meeting us a couple of hours later at the hotel.  In the envelope was just a few brochures.  We duly met with the person as advised but only now on reflection do I believe it's a bit of a scam as we foolishly booked a couple of trips with them.  PLEASE do not do this should you have the same situation before you have checked out the other offerings from the other agencies in Funchal as I believe we paid far far more than we would have if we'd have booked elsewhere and then to add insult to injury the first trip the driver turned up 30 minutes late and then the second tour they forgot us altogether and had to come back for us after starting the trip!  I simply believe details are passed on to individuals when they establish you haven't booked through a tour company, so want to make others aware.  AND there is now a little bar/restaurant called Boa Vista just a short walk down from the hotel which has just been done up by a Portuguese chap who has returned having run a restaurant in Jersey for years.  We had a few drinks there and it's a lovely clean and friendly and very reasonably priced!!

hotel_name: Porto PalÃƒÂ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
date: Connecting some dotswrote a review Aug 2019
text: This is our forth time staying in this hotel. And the last time was an year ago, in between they renovated the lobby and looks a lot nicer with the new setting, the hotel still have record of our previous stays but all the friendly and familiar faces are gone. Even it is listed as 5 stars hotel, but the room we stayed in this time is only up to 3 stars standard. The shower was very week, the fixtures were broken, the bathtub was worn out with stains, the towels were also worn out... we booked online, the least thing they should have done is listed it as \un-refurbish\" type of room."

Suman and Sunil were extremely helpful. They made our stay comfortable. We ended up extending our trip and enjoy every minute of it. I would highly recommend this hotel.We had the one bedroom deluxe sea view apartment which was clean and modern. Beds were comfortable, we had two single beds and they were big.

We booked only a month before never visited Portugal before, amazing hotel. Staff very helpful and friendly. Spotlessly clean, room cleaned every day. The all you can eat buffet had everything you needed so much choice. Spa and gym good to relax in and the outside pool area was lovely with a very good bar at a reasonable rate. Would not recommend if you have teenagers as nothing for them to do as a very quiet resorts.

The location of the apartment is conveniently just a short walk from the train station, making it easy to access. The staff were incredibly helpful, and our email correspondence with them was flawless, ensuring a smooth check-in process.During our two-night stay, we were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary Porto wine tasting upon our arrival, which added a special touch to our experience. The apartment itself is well-equipped with all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay, providing everything we required and more.

We are staying in the quinta for 6 nights already. The place is like a rural property within nicely kept gardens just 10 minutes drive from lagos. The apartments are very nice and so is the breakfast. The owners are very friendly and interesting people willing to give you information about anything. Twice a week they organise a bbq in the quinta which gives a chance to meet the other families. The pool is fine and there is also a table tennis and a soccer field. Every apartment has a small veranda where you can relax. Generally the place is very laid back, just what we wanted in our holidays. If you would like something like that, then it is the place for you.

Beautiful B&B in a beautiful little village.  We spent 3 nights relaxing at the Villa after driving down from Lisbon. The villa is beautiful in beautiful grounds just a short, if steep, walk from the beach and the few restaurants and bars. We were there mid-may which is nice and quiet but still warm enough for bikinis and to use the pool. Olivier is a delightful host providing lovely fresh goodies for breakfast, honestly I have nothing but praise.

Late deal booked for some early sunshine over half termIÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll start with the good points;We had an excellent, spacious, and well equipped room with view over the pool as well as a sea view.The Ocean bar was well ran, with friendly staff and entertainment was provided by Mauro who did his best to keep people amused.Now the bad points;Due to a local festival the hotel had accepted multiple coach parties which led to ridiculously long queues at meal times (one access in and out). This was worsened by the barricading off around the pool area in an attempt to provide Al fresco dining.The hotel has pretensions to be all inclusive - this it most certainly isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t, at best it could deliver half board.The pool bar was in the main restaurant and was only available from 1200, so if you wanted a soft drink of anything prior it came out of your own pocket.The food was repetitive and bland, and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a pretty sad state of affairs when the hottest food they can serve is salad or yogurt..!If you want cheap and cheerful there is better value for money to be had in Albufeira.This was very much the same sentiment being echoed by other guests we spoke too.Needless to say we wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be returningÃ¢â‚¬Â¦.

First time to Maderia and this hotel is stunning.  The views have got to be one of best on the island.  Our room was lovely with sea view.  The hotel is clean and staff very helpful and attentive.  The pool area is fantastic and never really got busy so felt it was almost your own private pool and again amazing views.  Folklore night every Friday 25 euros is well worth the money and very entertaining.  The hotel provides a courtesy bus every day apart from Sundays at 10 and 3 down into town (10 min ride) or 1 and 5pm pick up from town.  The local yellow bus is frequent enough and cost 1.80 euros, you can get daily tickets etc. from the hotel.  One thing to remember if getting the bus, the stop is right outside the hotel driveway entrance.  This is on a very steep bend in the road so please stand behind the hotel wall and not at the bus stop.  The reason for this is on our first bus trip out a car took the bend far too fast and careered towards us standing at the bus stop.  Fortunately we jumped out of it's way and the car and us remained undamaged but did shake us up.

This is an outstanding hotel! The employees are very knowledgeable about the area and friendly as well. My room was too warm and the front desk immediately moved us to a different room. The hotel is spotless clean and beautifully appointed. Breakfast was very nice.
Awesome place and food, Madhav was a great waiter, very friendly, helpful. Decor was amazing, so colourful, vibrant and welcoming.

From the delightful hotel receptionist who gave us a room at 11.00am well before check in and handed over maps and a quick overview of the city, to the very energetic, efficient and smiley breakfast staff, this hotel has it all - great location, great price, clean, modern and extensive breakfast. Every member of staff we passed spoke and offered help. There are even cookies on the reception desk. Thank you. Lisbon is a great city.

Nice place with amazing view to the ocean. Restaurants in walking distance. Tidy room and comfy beds. Good breakfast to enjoy in the backyard. This a great place to relax and enjoy sunshine and view! Only disadvantages: no elevator, no parking place and sometimes problem with wifi access. Overall highly recommended place to stay for short time.

Stayed here for a couple of nights in October 2014. It's in the business district with no immediately adjacent restaurants and so the lack of one in the hotel is a disadvantage. They do breakfast (good ones at that) only, plus bar snacks. There are however some decent restaurants within a fifteen/twenty minute walk.Room was small with not much space round our double bed but it was very clean and it and the bathroom were well equipped.

We stayed here in May 2013, for two nights.  This was my 3rd visit to Tomar but my first to this hotel.  It was a lovely hotel in a great location on the river.  Our room and bathroom were massive and the views over the pool, river and to the historic citidel were simply amazing.  The food at breakfast was plentiful, plenty of parking, friendly staff etc....There was an extra charge for the sauna but this is not a 5 star hotel so it did not taint my opinion too much.  Also, some of the decor is a bit dated but this added to the charm.  I will consider this hotel again on my next visit to Central Portugal.  Overall, highly recommended.

I was staying in Albufeira but wanted to visit Lisbon for an overnight  stay (29 June). I booked this hotel after careful consideration through Travel Republic, with my debit card. The next day I got an e-mail from the hotel saying my CREDIT card had been rejected and could I contact them to provide details of another card. Numerous attempts to do this via e-mail (copied to Travel Republic) and phone calls to the hotel's answering machine proved unsuccessful so I decided not to make the trip to Lisbon, without a confirmed hotel booking. On return to UK, I found that there was in fact no problem with any of my cards but that my debit card had in fact been debited to the price of Â£58. Since then, I have been trying to get an explanation - and refund for a hotel room I never had. I have simply been ignored.  I have now had to accept I've been charged Â£58 for a room I never had. Appalling customer service from both the hotel and Travel Republic. Mike Hurley, Luton

hotel_name: Quinta do Morgado - Monte da Eira Apartments
text: I stayed in a T0 I missed a towel stand.Modern apartments, outdoor space a lot of care. Enterprise with all amenities, cozy apartment.

Lovely hotel located within the medieval walls of Marvao. The hotel has a reserved parking space outside, elevator and acceptable WiFi connection. Our room, (with mountain view) had a small balcony with views towards the castelo and a window with a superb view on the plain. Room very clean with a pretty confortable bed, also the bathroom was ok. Staff very friendly and helpful, We had an excellent traditional dinner in the restaurant and also the breakfast was very good. Would stay here again.

Though the room was somewhat cramped, staff was very friendly and helpful. One staff member was not only all those but had a great sense of humor as well. Location was in a quiet neighborhood but accessible to bus, metro or taxi. I just have one suggestion - don't wait to be asked to help with the luggage of old people. Please volunteer to lend them a hand.

We didn't stay there for the night but we went there twice for lunch. The place is in the way to the Serra, it has a nice view and the food is nice. There is a private parking for the cars, and a swimming pool.

Wonderful hotel in an extraordinary setting nestled in the heart of a splendid natural area, a magnificent golf course, services (Spa, swimming pools, golf, parking, shuttles, bar, restaurant) and discreet and very efficient staff.The rooms are spacious and very well equipped. Very large bedding, minibar, safe, bathrobes...Very nice experience to repeat. THANKS
Very modern and clean hotel. Very friendly staff! It was a bit cold during breakfast because of the airco. Breakfast is very good. You can select a normal or English breakfast.

Thank you Dieter and Sigi for yet another wonderful holiday at Bellevue.  The environment you create is excellent, and the families and visitors who come - often year after year like us - make it such a special holiday.  Hello - and Guten Tag - to all our 'holiday friends' who we met again this year!
